definition: lost/missing/to lose (sb in one's charge)/to get lost/to wander away/to lose (flavor, freshness, shape, hair, one's good looks etc)/to lose meaning (in translation)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: I always get lost in mazes.
Men scoured the country looking for the lost child.
sentences.chinese: 人们走遍全国寻找那个走失的儿童。

sentences.english: Pound the cows so they don't stray.
sentences.chinese: 把这些走失的牛关进待领场，这样它们就不会乱跑了。

sentences.english: STAY PUT and blow whistle if lost.
sentences.chinese: 如果走失了，原地呆着，吹哨子。

sentences.english: Mengke's second elder sister has found the lost lamb in the bush.
sentences.chinese: 二姐在灌木里发现了走失的羊羔。

sentences.english: The last time I caught him straying I used it on little Jake.
sentences.chinese: 最后一次抓到走失的小杰克时，我用了那个法子。

sentences.english: The soundtrack of the first Runaway has stayed chugging round the heads of many players.
sentences.chinese: 原声带首走失留欧一轮首脑许多球员。

sentences.english: Occasionally one of the lambs will stray, and there’s nothing more vulnerable than a sheep without it’s shepherd.
sentences.chinese: 有时会有羊走失在外，对羊来说这是再危险不过的。

sentences.english: For instance, you don't often see stray cattle roaming the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 例如，你不会经常看见走失的牛群在村里闲逛。

sentences.english: They were beating about for the missing child.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在到处寻找那个走失的孩子。

sentences.english: It was this car he was playing with when he got lost.
sentences.chinese: 他就是因为玩遥控车走失的。

sentences.english: The lost child was led back by a people's policeman.
sentences.chinese: 走失的孩子由一个人民警察领回来了。

sentences.english: He looked like a lost child.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去就像走失的孩子。

sentences.english: Mrs Green mothered the lost children.
sentences.chinese: 格林太太慈母般地关爱走失儿童。

sentences.english: My dog wandered off and got lost.
Richard Wetherill and his brother-in-law were trying to find some missing cattle.
sentences.chinese: 理查和他的妹夫在寻找一些走失的牲畜。

definition: to wander off/to stray/to get lost
to lose the way/lost/labyrinth/labyrinthus vestibularis (of the inner ear)
owner of sth lost or stolen
to leave home (to live somewhere else)
to report a case to the authorities
to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
civil police/PRC police/abbr. for 人民警察
to dispatch police to the scene of crime, accident etc
old man or woman/the elderly/one's aged parents or grandparents
